column4: So it appears that when I view an image with the Image Viewer app, a small thumbnail of the image is generated in ~/.thumbnails/normal. In Nautilus I have it set to never generate thumbnails, and list view by default. How do I turn off whatever it is that's generating and saving these thumbs?
that is a gconf-editor app... can also be done in the graphical interface...
in the folder view open up home folder and change preferences...
I did. I'm looking right now at apps --> eog in gconf-editor and looking for an option that has to do with ~/.thumbnails/normal.
no no it hold on.... that was just away to point you in direction that has to do with nautlics... not the apps..

I did say that I'd already gone through Nautilus's preferences... I think it's only doing this when I open an image with eog, whereas it used to cache a thumbnail for every image that Nautilus previewed while in icon mode.
in the folder view or image view area... not sure which one your getting at???

I'm not sure what you mean, so I'll kind of start over... when I open an image with Eye of Gnome, it saves a thumbnail of that image in ~/.thumbnails/normal. As far as I can tell, this has nothing to do with Nautilus, because I have thumbnail caching disabled in Nautilus.
nothing in eog stating saving thumbnails using gconf editor..??? hold on I will look around... at file set up...
Nope, I don't see any options.
I agree, what is the big deal with this option I have the same thumbnails folder as well??
the size is only 8.3 kbs... not much drive space being eaten...
It's just something I want to maintain control over.
appears most of these thumbnails are used for my desktop settings...
It also generates a thumb if you open an image from, say, ~/Pictures/
understand... just not sure your going to be able to stop this idea... most of the pictures you use for backgroud that is the thumbnail it is producing...
Yeah, that's the conclusion I'm coming to as well.
the size is not greater then 20 kbs not sure it is even worth messing with...
I suppose. Thanks for your help :)
found thumbnailer under gconf-editor under shceme gnome thumbnailer...
there it is
Good find, but it's still generating thumbs for me when I open an image.
under Desktop> Gnome> there is thumbnailer > it allows you to disable all not sure what this does though???
well played with the idea enough have to wash dishes and vaccum later good luck... :)
